items.title: Install VS Code Jetson Orin
items.author: Atharva Hude
items.description:
Title: How to Install Visual Studio Code on Nvidia Jetson Orin: A Step-by-Step Guide

Introduction:
Nvidia Jetson Orin is a powerful platform that can be used for a variety of tasks, including AI and robotics development. One of the essential tools for software development is a code editor, and Visual Studio Code (VS Code) stands out as a popular choice among developers due to its versatility and extensive ecosystem of extensions. In this tutorial, we’ll walk you through the process of installing VS Code on Nvidia Jetson Orin.

Step 1: Download the ARM64 Version of Visual Studio Code
https://code.visualstudio.com/download

Step 2: Install Visual Studio Code
Once you have downloaded the .deb package of Visual Studio Code, you can proceed with the installation process. Open a terminal window on your Nvidia Jetson Orin device and navigate to the directory where the .deb package is located.

Use the following command to install the package:

sudo dpkg -i package_file.deb

Replace “package_file.deb” with the name of the .deb package you downloaded. This command will install Visual Studio Code on your Nvidia Jetson Orin device.

Step 3: Launch Visual Studio Code
After the installation process is complete, you can launch Visual Studio Code from the application menu or by typing “code” in the terminal. Once launched, you’ll have access to a powerful and feature-rich code editor that you can use for your software development projects.

Conclusion:
In this tutorial, we’ve covered the steps required to install Visual Studio Code on Nvidia Jetson Orin. By following these steps, you can set up a powerful development environment for your projects and take advantage of the features offered by Visual Studio Code.

Once you have downloaded the .deb package of Visual Studio Code, you can proceed with the installation process. Open a terminal window on your Nvidia Jetson Orin device and navigate to the directory where the .deb package is located.

Use the following command to install the package:

Step 3: Launch Visual Studio Code
After the installation process is complete, you can launch Visual Studio Code from the application menu or by typing “code” in the terminal. Once launched, you’ll have access to a powerful and feature-rich code editor that you can use for your software development projects.
